indirect.description: Dependencies of direct dependencies (also known as sub-dependencies, or transient dependencies).

all.description: All explicitly defined dependencies. For bundler, pip, composer, cargo, also the dependencies of direct dependencies.

production.description: Only dependencies in the 'Product dependency group'.

development.description: Only dependencies in the 'Development dependency group'.

auto.description: Try to differentiate between apps and libraries. Use 'increase' for apps and 'widen' for libraries.

increase.description: Always increase the minimum version requirement to match the new version. If a range already exists, typically this only increases the lower bound.

increase-if-necessary.description: Leave the constraint if the original constraint allows the new version, otherwise, bump the constraint.

lockfile-only.description: Only create pull requests to update lockfiles. Ignore any new versions that would require package manifest changes.

widen.description: Widen the allowed version requirements to include both the new and old versions, when possible. Typically, this only increases the maximum allowed version requirement.

assignees.description: Assignees to set on pull requests

commit-message.description: Dependabot attempts to detect your commit message preferences and use similar patterns. Use this option to specify your preferences explicitly.

prefix.description: A prefix for all commit messages. When you specify a prefix for commit messages, GitHub will automatically add a colon between the defined prefix and the commit message provided the defined prefix ends with a letter, number, closing parenthesis, or closing bracket. This means that, for example, if you end the prefix with a whitespace, there will be no colon added between the prefix and the commit message.

prefix-development.description: A separate prefix for all commit messages that update dependencies in the Development dependency group. When you specify a value for this option, the prefix is used only for updates to dependencies in the Production dependency group. This is not supported by all package ecosystems.

include.description: Specifies that any prefix is followed by a list of the dependencies updated in the commit.

cooldown.description: Defines a cooldown period for dependency updates, allowing updates to be delayed for a configurable number of days. This feature enables users to customize how often Dependabot generates new version updates, offering greater control over update frequency.

default-days.description: Default cooldown period for dependencies without specific rules (optional).

semver-major-days.description: Cooldown period for major version updates (optional, applies only to package managers supporting SemVer).

semver-minor-days.description: Cooldown period for minor version updates (optional, applies only to package managers supporting SemVer).

semver-patch-days.description: Cooldown period for patch version updates (optional, applies only to package managers supporting SemVer).

include.description: List of dependencies to apply cooldown. Supports wildcards (`*`).

exclude.description: List of dependencies excluded from cooldown. Supports wildcards (`*`).

exclude-paths.description: List of file paths to exclude from dependency updates

groups.description: Configure groups for dependencies. Each 'groups' property is arbitrary will appear in pull request titles and branch names. For example, the code snippet '{"groups": {"NPM dependencies": {"patterns": ["*"]}}}' sets the group name to 'NPM dependencies'.

applies-to.description: Use to specify a whether the rules in the group apply to version updates or security updates.

dependency-type.description: Specify a dependency type to be included in the group.

patterns.description: Define strings of characters that match with a dependency name (or multiple dependency names) to include those dependencies in the group.

exclude-patterns.description: Exclude certain dependencies from the group. If a dependency is excluded from a group, Dependabot will continue to raise single pull requests to update the dependency to its latest version.

update-types.description: Specify the semantic versioning level to include in the group

group-by.description: Configure how dependencies are grouped within this group.

dependency-name.description: Use to ignore updates for dependencies with matching names, optionally using * to match zero or more characters.

update-types.description: Use to ignore types of updates. You can combine this with 'dependency-name: "*"' to ignore particular update-types for all dependencies.

versions.description: Use to ignore specific versions or ranges of versions. If you want to define a range, use the standard pattern for the package manager.

insecure-external-code-execution.description: Allow or deny code execution in manifest files

labels.description: Labels to set on pull requests

milestone.description: Associate all pull requests raised for a package manager with a milestone. You need to specify the numeric identifier of the milestone and not its label.

name.description: A name for the update configuration.

open-pull-requests-limit.description: Limit number of open pull requests for version updates

package-ecosystem.$comment: These values are restricted by a top-level if-then-else when 'enable-beta-ecosystems' is not enabled.

separator.description: Change separator for PR branch name

rebase-strategy.description: Disable automatic rebasing. 'auto' is the default and Dependabot will rebase open pull requests when changes are detected. 'disabled' will disable automatic rebasing.

registries.$comment: 'registries' must be either an array of strings, or the string constant '*'.

day.description: Specify an alternative day to check for updates

time.description: Specify an alternative time of day to check for updates (format: hh:mm)

timezone.description: The time zone identifier must be from the Time Zone database maintained by IANA

cronjob.description: Specify a valid cron expression for updates

allOf.$comment: If interval type is 'cron', enforce 'cronjob' property.

target-branch.description: Specify a different branch for manifest files and for pull requests.

vendor.description: Tell Dependabot to vendor dependencies when updating them. Don't use this option if you're using 'gomod'.

versioning-strategy.description: How to update manifest version requirements

patterns.description: Array of dependency patterns to include in a multi-ecosystem group. Required when using multi-ecosystem-group. Use '*' to include all dependencies.

multi-ecosystem-group.description: String identifier linking this ecosystem to a multi-ecosystem group

allOf.$comment: Schedule is required UNLESS multi-ecosystem-group is specified
If multi-ecosystem-group is specified, patterns is required

registry.description: The top-level registries key is optional. It allows you to specify authentication details that Dependabot can use to access private package registries.

url.description: The URL to use to access the dependencies in this registry. The protocol is optional. If not specified, 'https://' is assumed. Dependabot adds or ignores trailing slashes as required.

username.description: The username that Dependabot uses to access the registry.

password.description: A reference to a Dependabot secret containing the password for the specified user.

key.description: A reference to a Dependabot secret containing an access key for this registry.

token.description: A reference to a Dependabot secret containing an access token for this registry.

replaces-base.description: For registries with type: python-index, if the boolean value is true, pip resolves dependencies by using the specified URL rather than the base URL of the Python Package Index (by default https://pypi.org/simple).

registry.description: The name of the cargo registry.

tenant-id.description: The tenant ID for Azure OIDC authentication.

client-id.description: The client ID for Azure OIDC authentication.

jfrog-oidc-provider-name.description: The JFrog OIDC provider name for authentication.

identity-mapping-name.description: The identity mapping name for JFrog OIDC authentication.

audience.description: The audience for OIDC or AWS authentication.

aws-region.description: The AWS region for AWS CodeArtifact authentication.

account-id.description: The AWS account ID for AWS CodeArtifact authentication.

role-name.description: The AWS role name for AWS CodeArtifact authentication.

domain.description: The domain for AWS CodeArtifact authentication.

domain-owner.description: The domain owner for AWS CodeArtifact authentication.

multi-ecosystem-group.description: Define a group that spans multiple package ecosystems, allowing consolidated pull requests across different ecosystems

day.description: Specify an alternative day to check for updates

time.description: Specify an alternative time of day to check for updates (format: hh:mm)

timezone.description: The time zone identifier must be from the Time Zone database maintained by IANA

cronjob.description: Specify a valid cron expression for updates

allOf.$comment: If interval type is 'cron', enforce 'cronjob' property.

labels.description: Labels to set on pull requests (additive - merges with ecosystem-level labels)

assignees.description: Assignees to set on pull requests (additive - merges with ecosystem-level assignees)

milestone.description: Associate all pull requests raised for this group with a milestone. You need to specify the numeric identifier of the milestone and not its label.

target-branch.description: Specify a different branch for manifest files and for pull requests.

commit-message.description: Commit message preferences for the group

prefix.description: A prefix for all commit messages

prefix-development.description: A separate prefix for all commit messages that update dependencies in the Development dependency group

include.description: Specifies that any prefix is followed by a list of the dependencies updated in the commit

pull-request-branch-name.description: Pull request branch name preferences for the group

separator.description: Change separator for PR branch name

open-pull-requests-limit.description: Limit number of open pull requests for version updates.

update-types.description: Specify the semantic versioning update types for the group.

dependency-type.description: Specify a dependency type to be included in the group.

exclude-patterns.description: Exclude certain dependencies from the group.

version.title: Config file version
version.description: Dependabot configuration files require this key, and its value must be 2

enable-beta-ecosystems.description: Enable ecosystems that have beta-level support

items.title: Package Ecosystem
items.description: Element for each one package manager that you want GitHub Dependabot to monitor for new versions

multi-ecosystem-groups.description: Define groups that span multiple package ecosystems, allowing consolidated pull requests across different ecosystems

allOf.$comment: If 'enable-beta-ecosystems' is NOT enabled, enforce known 'package-ecosystem' values.
